chinese: develop or come from sth. else 源自；源于
examples: e.g. This word is [[derived]] from Latin, meaning "water."；e.g. Medically, we will [[derive]] great benefit from the application of this technique.

chinese: vt.get sth., esp. an advantage or a pleasant feeling, from sth. 得到，获得（优势或愉快的感受）
examples: e.g. This word is [[derived]] from Latin, meaning "water."；e.g. Medically, we will [[derive]] great benefit from the application of this technique.

chinese: 1) make sb. feel sexually excited 激起···的性欲
examples: e.g. His strange behavior at the meeting yesterday [[aroused]] my suspicion.

chinese: 2) make sb. have a particular feeling or attitude 激起（感情、态度）
examples: e.g. His strange behavior at the meeting yesterday [[aroused]] my suspicion.

chinese: consisting of or relating to the cells of plants or animals 由细胞组成的；细胞的
examples: e.g. Researchers have been observing the course of the disease at the cellular level.

chinese: [C] （计算机屏幕上显示准备接受指令的）提示， 提示符
examples: e.g. The computer program will [[prompt]] the user to enter data where it is required.

chinese: vt.make people say or do sth. as a reaction 引起，激起（某人说或做某事）
examples: e.g. The computer program will [[prompt]] the user to enter data where it is required.

chinese: 1) an instruction to a computer to do sth. 指令
examples: e.g. Check that the computer has executed the [[commands]] that you typed in.；e.g. An officer stood on one of the tanks and began shouting [[commands]] through a loudspeaker.

chinese: 2) an order that should be obeyed 命令；指示
examples: e.g. Check that the computer has executed the [[commands]] that you typed in.；e.g. An officer stood on one of the tanks and began shouting [[commands]] through a loudspeaker.

chinese: (fml.) sb. who receives sth. 接受者；领受者
examples: e.g. I felt glad that I was a giver of pleasure, not merely a passive [[recipient]].

chinese: [U, sing.] the movement of blood around your body 血液循环
examples: e.g. Stretching is a good way to relax muscles and to increase blood [[circulation]] during long-time air travel.

chinese: [U] 胰岛素
[U] 葡萄糖
[U] 睾酮
[U] 瘦蛋白
eat too much, or eat more than is healthy 吃得过多； 暴食
examples: e.g. A woman who [[overeats]] during pregnancy can cause health problems for her child.

chinese: over a wide area 弥漫地；扩散地；漫射地
examples: e.g. One weakness of the essay is that the information is given diffusely instead of in a certain section, thereby reducing the effective communication of ideas.

chinese: [C] 甲状腺
moving, reacting or working more slowly than normal and in a way that seems lazy 缓慢的；迟缓的；懒洋洋的
examples: e.g. The company has been rather [[sluggish]] in responding to the rapid changes in technology.

chinese: (not before noun) not knowing about or not noticing sth. that is happening around you 不知道的；未察觉到的
examples: e.g. He went on and on about how successful he was, [[oblivious]] to the fact that he had hurt her.

chinese: increase or improve sth. and make it more successful 促进；推动；使兴旺
examples: e.g. They won the semi-final and this [[boosted]] the morale (士气) of the team.

chinese: (also adrenalin) [U] 肾上腺素
[C] （从0到9的任何一个）数字
existing or popular for only a short time 短暂的；只流行一时的
examples: e.g. Many words appearing during that period were quite [[ephemeral]] and have passed into history.

chinese: make inactive 使不活动；使不活跃
examples: e.g. Researchers have identified antibodies (抗体) that [[inactivate]] the virus before it has the chance to change itself.

chinese: [C] 肾；肾脏
[C, U] sb. / sth. that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern 例外；除外
examples: e.g. Few guitarists can sing as well as they can play; however, he is an [[exception]].

chinese: continue to exist, be noticeable, etc. for longer than is usual or desirable 继续留存（较惯常或理想的时间长）
examples: e.g. The faint smell of her perfume [[lingered]] on in the room long after she had left.

chinese: (usu. before noun) (fml.) relating to the ability to show what is going to happen in the future 预测的； 预言的；前瞻的
examples: e.g. Newton's physical theories are a good example of how a scientific theory may be [[predictive]] as well as explanatory.

chinese: 1) when half a period of time has passed （一段时间）在中间的；到一半（的）
examples: e.g. She was interrupted by the chairperson when she was [[midway]] through her presentation.；e.g. We are coming close to the [[midway]] point between Los Angeles and San Francisco.

chinese: 2) between two places, and the same distance from each of them 在中途（的）；在半路（的）；在中间（的）
examples: e.g. She was interrupted by the chairperson when she was [[midway]] through her presentation.；e.g. We are coming close to the [[midway]] point between Los Angeles and San Francisco.

chinese: [U] a feeling of excitement about sth. enjoyable that is going to happen in the near future 期望；盼望
examples: e.g. There was a sense of [[anticipation]] in the audience as the curtain went up for the play.

chinese: [U] 胃泌素；促胃液素
make sth. happen very quickly, esp. a series of events 引发，激发（尤指一系列事件）
examples: e.g. There must be specific events which [[triggered]] the aggressive displays in your dog.

chinese: [C, U] 酸（一种化学物质）
[U] the process of digesting food 消化（过程）
examples: e.g. [[Digestion]] is the organic process by which food is converted into substances that can be absorbed into the body.

chinese: [C] 腺
[C] (AmE tumor) 肿瘤；肿块；瘤
[U] 甲状腺功能亢进
1) sb.'s height or size 身高；身材
examples: e.g. I was by no means short in [[stature]], but next to this man I felt like a dwarf (矮子).；e.g. At that time there were no other universities in England equal in [[stature]] to Oxford and Cambridge.

chinese: 2) the degree to which sb. is admired or regarded as important 名声；声望
examples: e.g. I was by no means short in [[stature]], but next to this man I felt like a dwarf (矮子).；e.g. At that time there were no other universities in England equal in [[stature]] to Oxford and Cambridge.

chinese: 1) if a large amount of a liquid, electricity, chemical, etc. surges, it moves very quickly and suddenly （大量液体）汹涌；（电流）浪涌；（化学物等）突然涌动
examples: e.g. Adrenaline [[surged]] through her veins.；e.g. After the doors of the theater opened, the crowd [[surged]] forward and police had to intervene.

chinese: 2) suddenly move very quickly in a particular direction 迅速涌动；蜂拥向前
examples: e.g. Adrenaline [[surged]] through her veins.；e.g. After the doors of the theater opened, the crowd [[surged]] forward and police had to intervene.

chinese: 1) used for emphasizing the difference between two situations 而（用于强调两种情况之间的差异）
examples: e.g. Stress can be extremely damaging to your health. Exercise, [[meanwhile]], can reduce its effects.；e.g. The hurricane will reach the island this evening. [[Meanwhile]], residents are being evacuated (转移).

chinese: 2) while sth. else is happening 与此同时
examples: e.g. Stress can be extremely damaging to your health. Exercise, [[meanwhile]], can reduce its effects.；e.g. The hurricane will reach the island this evening. [[Meanwhile]], residents are being evacuated (转移).

chinese: 1) prevent sth. from growing or developing, or from working effectively 抑制（生长、发展、起作用等）
examples: e.g. It is probable that the medication will [[suppress]] the symptom without treating the condition.；e.g. Illegal cross-border transactions are very active in this area despite international attempts to [[suppress]] them.

chinese: 2) stop opposition or protest using military force or strict laws （凭借武力或严格的法律）平定，制止，镇压
examples: e.g. It is probable that the medication will [[suppress]] the symptom without treating the condition.；e.g. Illegal cross-border transactions are very active in this area despite international attempts to [[suppress]] them.

chinese: [U] 尿
(infml.) pass liquid waste from your body 撒尿
examples: e.g. I need to [[pee]] before I leave. It's going to be a long journey.

chinese: do sth. because of another person's advice or order, or because you have received information or had an idea 根据···行事
examples: e.g. A patient will usually listen to the doctor's advice and [[act]] on it.

chinese: increase the level of sth. slightly so as to bring it back to the level you want 补足；将···增加到所需之量
examples: e.g. He had to do extra jobs on the weekend to [[top]] up his income and support the family.

chinese: write your final message at the end of an informal letter （写非正式信件时）收笔
examples: e.g. It's getting late, so she wrote a few more lines and [[signed]] off with "Yours, Janet."

chinese: 欧内斯特 • 斯塔林（英国生理学家）
（英国）皇家内科医师学会
沃达丰（世界著名的跨国移动通讯网络公司）
弗雷德里克 • 马丁尼（人名）
一款“阅后即焚”的信息分享应用程序
